lines.text: Well, you dictate so fast, I never know where my skirt is.
Thirty years ago, I decided to devote myself entirely to beautiful young women and fine old wines. Since then, I've always been intoxicated by one or the other.

[upon walking in on Baron Josef and Susie in a tight embrace]
Hmmm. Looks like another merger to me.
Women are for non-working hours... you distract me.

No woman should look pretty who works in a bank. It disturbs the bankers. Takes the eyes of the tellers away from the bills and currency. The clerks become confused with their columns. It's dangerous. Invites disaster.
Well, Ludwig, how do you flying?
Oh, I don't think it'll ever take the place of the horse and buggy.

[Speaking to Miss Frey]
Pretty women... should NEVER think!
Poor child... 21, and no sweetheart? Addicted to "Love at Dawn" perfume. Smartly dressed. Silk stockings over perfect legs. An exquisite pair of shoulders. In short, a very distracting young woman.
Oh, Baron!
Miss Frey, you'll please report yourself to the head of the Personnel Department.
What for?
To tell the manager that you are no longer employed here. Your career as a woman is too promising for me to wreck.
Tell me, tell me... Did you meet many beautiful ladies in America, eh?
No. I didn't speak to a woman while I was gone, unless it was someone's secretary. When I'm on business, I work. When I make love, I keep my mind on it. But both together? Never!

[Speaking to the Baron]
Well, I'll be running along. I never keep a man away from his work. It's a vice I never practice myself, but I'm very liberal-minded towards those who are addicted to it.

[the Baron's phone rings]
Hello?
Hello, darling. It's Mimi. I just had to call you up. I bet you don't know where I am. I'm in the bathtub. Hear me splash?
[Splashes water in the tub]
Go splash in the lake!
[hangs up the phone]
